item.title: 6 months ,3 reports but nothing done by Council, 12th November
item.description:
I am writing yet again to report constant fly tipping on Woodhill road near Woodhill School.This is outrages as pile is growing everyday. We have reported this 3 times already but nothing has been done.Totaly unacceptable and this is right next to Schools and new housing development Trinity Park.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Prospect Vale, Woolwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous/slippery leaf litter in cycle lane, 12th November
item.description:
Slippy leaf litter in the cycle lane junction between Heygate Street and Sayer Street. Leaf litter has been here for several weeks. Caused me and another cyclist behind me to fall off of our bikes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sayer Street, Elephant and Castle, London

item.title: Overflowing leaves covering the pavement and kerb, 12th November
item.description:
For the past week leaves have covered the pavement and road, including the kerbs making it difficult and unsafe for residence and public to walk down. I am a disabled resident and I nearly fell over due to not being able to see pavement Road and kerb.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunsmure Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Leaves on the pavement, 12th November
item.description:
There are so many leaves on the pavement, and with the constant rain it is a real safety hazard as it is very very slippery. The elderly and children can easily fall. and I've watched it happen.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bethune Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large shards of smashed green glass, 12th November
item.description:
Dangerous pieces of smashed glass on pavement and side of road from green bottle. Possibly accidentally dropped by bin men during recycling collection. Hazard to pedestrians, toddlers, and road used parking up in area due to size and sharpness.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Freelands Road, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blenheim Road, deep holes near telephone pole on the grass verge, structure unsafe., 12th November
item.description:
Reported before and Bexley says fixed but it has not, still holes now I think it may not be foxes as holes are so deep, please investigate. Also now the barriers gets blown down by the wind and hazard on the pavement. Shown in photo. Please fix soon. —————————— Previous report Foxes have been continuously digging around the telephone poll, lamp post and rectangular cover on a grass verge for many months. We see them most night around that area. In total, there are 11 holes dug up and some are very deep. I am worried that the post and pole will fall as the foundation are weak. They also keep fouling all around that area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Blenheim Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet
